questions.question: Which is the shear strength parameter which deals with the friction and interlocking behavior of the soil.

explanations.a: Cohesion is the shear parameter which deals with the internal bonding of the particles due to electrostatic force or cementing property.
explanations.b: Shear stress is the combined value obtained by the addition of the two shear parameters.
explanations.c: Strain is defined as the ratio of change of length to initial length and thus cannot be a shear strength parameter.
explanations.d: Angle of internal friction is the shear strength parameter which deals with the friction and interlocking property of the soil.

questions.question: In which type of soil the strength is purely due to cohesion and angle of internal  friction will be zero.

explanations.a: As the name itself suggests, the soil is characterised by its cohesive property and these types of soil do not show any interlocking behaviour between the particles.
explanations.b: As the name suggests, the cohesion parameter in these types of soils are zero and all its strength is from the friction and interlocking of the particles with each other.
explanations.c: In fine grained soils, various types of soils can be included having different properties and these soils may possess cohesive property or cohesionless property or can also be a combination of the two parameters.
explanations.d: In coarse grained soils, various types of soils can be included having different properties and these soils may possess cohesive property or cohesionless property or can also be a combination of the two parameters.

questions.question: Unconfined compression test is conducted to determine

explanations.a: The UCS test is performed to find out the undrained compression strength of the soil as well as to calculate the   shear strength and its respective shear parameters.
explanations.b: The tensile property of soil cannot be found out using UCS testing.
explanations.c: The compressibility of the soil is usually found by conducting a confined compression test (CCT) or also called  standard oedometer test.
explanations.d: The UCS test is performed to find out the undrained compression strength of the soil as well as to calculate the shear strength and its respective shear parameters.

questions.question: Sand is classified as which type of soil

explanations.a: For sand, cohesion is zero and hence it cannot be classified as C - soil.
explanations.b: Sand is classified as a Phi - soil as all the strength comes from the friction and interlocking between the particles.
explanations.c: As there is no bonding between the particles cohesion will be zero and hence sand cannot be classified as C - Phi soil
explanations.d: Sand is classified as a Phi - soil as all the strength comes from the friction and interlocking between the particles.

questions.question: Which type of soil completely depends on intermolecular friction between soil  and cohesive force is zero.

explanations.a: In cohesive soil, the shear strength is due to the cohesion parameter and hence is not the answer.
explanations.b: In non cohesive soil cohesion is zero and shear strength is purely due to intermolecular friction between the particles.
explanations.c: In fine grained soils, various types of soils can be included having different properties and these soils may possess cohesive property or cohesionless property or can also be a combination of the two parameters.
explanations.d: In coarse grained soils, various types of soils can be included having different properties and these soils may possess cohesive property or cohesionless property or can also be a combination of the two parameters.
